meta.note: User comments on articles with markdown support

schema.name: article_comments
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE "article_comments" (`id` char(36) NOT NULL, `article_title` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `author_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `author_email` varchar(255) NULL, `author_website` varchar(255) NULL, `comment_body` text NOT NULL, `parent_comment` char(36) NULL, `status` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending', `ip_address` varchar(255) NULL, `user_agent` varchar(255) NULL, `sort` integer NULL, `date_created` datetime NULL, `date_updated` datetime NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), CONSTRAINT `article_comments_parent_comment_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`parent_comment`) REFERENCES `article_comments` (`id`) ON DELETE SET NULL)

meta.note: Customer contact form submissions and support requests. Track inquiries from initial submission through resolution.

schema.name: contact_requests
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE "contact_requests" (`id` char(36) NOT NULL, `status` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'new', `name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `email` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `phone` varchar(255) NULL, `company` varchar(255) NULL, `category` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `priority` varchar(255) NULL DEFAULT 'medium', `subject` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `message` text NOT NULL, `internal_notes` text NULL, `sort` integer NULL, `user_created` char(36) NULL, `date_created` datetime NULL, `user_updated` char(36) NULL, `date_updated` datetime NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), CONSTRAINT `contact_requests_user_created_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`user_created`) REFERENCES `directus_users` (`id`), CONSTRAINT `contact_requests_user_updated_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`user_updated`) REFERENCES `directus_users` (`id`))

meta.note: Event registration form submissions. Track attendee registrations including dietary needs and special requests.

schema.name: event_registrations
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE "event_registrations" (`id` char(36) NOT NULL, `status` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'confirmed', `event` char(36) NOT NULL, `first_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `last_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `email` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `phone` varchar(255) NULL, `company` varchar(255) NULL, `job_title` varchar(255) NULL, `dietary_requirements` text NULL, `special_requests` text NULL, `ticket_type` varchar(255) NULL DEFAULT 'general', `confirmation_sent` boolean NULL DEFAULT '0', `sort` integer NULL, `date_created` datetime NULL, `date_updated` datetime NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), CONSTRAINT `event_registrations_event_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`event`) REFERENCES `events` (`id`) ON DELETE CASCADE)

meta.note: Event catalog for registration forms. Define events with dates, capacity, and details for attendee registration.

schema.name: events
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `events` (`id` char(36) not null, `status` varchar(255) not null default 'upcoming', `title` varchar(255) not null, `description` text null, `event_type` varchar(255) null, `event_date` datetime not null, `location` varchar(255) null, `capacity` integer null, `sort` integer null, `date_created` datetime null, `date_updated` datetime null, primary key (`id`))

meta.note: Job application form submissions. Track candidate applications with resumes, cover letters, and interview status.

schema.name: job_applications
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE "job_applications" (`id` char(36) NOT NULL, `status` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'submitted', `job_posting` char(36) NOT NULL, `first_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `last_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `email` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `phone` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `resume` char(36) NOT NULL, `cover_letter` char(36) NULL, `linkedin_url` varchar(255) NULL, `portfolio_url` varchar(255) NULL, `years_of_experience` integer NULL, `current_company` varchar(255) NULL, `expected_salary` varchar(255) NULL, `available_start_date` date NULL, `how_did_you_hear` varchar(255) NULL, `additional_info` text NULL, `recruiter_notes` text NULL, `sort` integer NULL, `date_created` datetime NULL, `date_updated` datetime NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), CONSTRAINT `job_applications_job_posting_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`job_posting`) REFERENCES `job_postings` (`id`) ON DELETE CASCADE, CONSTRAINT `job_applications_resume_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`resume`) REFERENCES `directus_files` (`id`) ON DELETE SET NULL, CONSTRAINT `job_applications_cover_letter_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`cover_letter`) REFERENCES `directus_files` (`id`) ON DELETE SET NULL)

meta.note: Job posting catalog for career pages. Define open positions with requirements and descriptions for application forms.

schema.name: job_postings
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `job_postings` (`id` char(36) not null, `status` varchar(255) not null default 'draft', `title` varchar(255) not null, `department` varchar(255) null, `location` varchar(255) null, `employment_type` varchar(255) null, `experience_level` varchar(255) null, `description` text null, `sort` integer null, `date_created` datetime null, `date_updated` datetime null, primary key (`id`))

meta.note: Marketing lead capture forms with UTM tracking and attribution. Convert website visitors into qualified sales leads.

schema.name: lead_captures
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE "lead_captures" (`id` char(36) NOT NULL, `status` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'new', `first_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `last_name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `email` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `phone` varchar(255) NULL, `company` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `job_title` varchar(255) NULL, `company_size` varchar(255) NULL, `industry` varchar(255) NULL, `interest` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `message` text NULL, `utm_source` varchar(255) NULL, `utm_medium` varchar(255) NULL, `utm_campaign` varchar(255) NULL, `utm_term` varchar(255) NULL, `utm_content` varchar(255) NULL, `landing_page` varchar(255) NULL, `referrer` varchar(255) NULL, `lead_score` integer NULL DEFAULT '0', `assigned_to` char(36) NULL, `sales_notes` text NULL, `sort` integer NULL, `user_created` char(36) NULL, `date_created` datetime NULL, `user_updated` char(36) NULL, `date_updated` datetime NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), CONSTRAINT `lead_captures_user_created_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`user_created`) REFERENCES `directus_users` (`id`), CONSTRAINT `lead_captures_user_updated_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`user_updated`) REFERENCES `directus_users` (`id`), CONSTRAINT `lead_captures_assigned_to_foreign` FOREIGN KEY (`assigned_to`) REFERENCES `directus_users` (`id`) ON DELETE SET NULL)

meta.note: Newsletter subscription management with subscriber preferences and tracking. Monitor email list growth and engagement.

schema.name: newsletter_signups
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `newsletter_signups` (`id` char(36) not null, `status` varchar(255) not null default 'pending', `email` varchar(255) not null, `first_name` varchar(255) null, `last_name` varchar(255) null, `interests` json null, `source` varchar(255) null, `sort` integer null, `date_created` datetime null, `date_updated` datetime null, primary key (`id`))

schema.name: quote_requests
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `quote_requests` (`id` char(36) not null, `company_name` varchar(255) not null, `contact_person` varchar(255) not null, `email` varchar(255) not null, `phone` varchar(255) null, `service_type` varchar(255) not null, `budget_range` varchar(255) null, `project_description` text not null, `timeline` varchar(255) null, `status` varchar(255) not null default 'new', `date_created` datetime null, primary key (`id`))

meta.note: Customer support ticket system for tracking issues and requests

schema.name: support_tickets
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `support_tickets` (`id` char(36) not null, `ticket_number` varchar(255) null, `customer_name` varchar(255) not null, `customer_email` varchar(255) not null, `priority` varchar(255) not null default 'medium', `category` varchar(255) null, `subject` varchar(255) not null, `description` text not null, `status` varchar(255) not null default 'open', `date_created` datetime null, `date_updated` datetime null, primary key (`id`))

meta.note: Customer satisfaction survey responses and feedback

schema.name: survey_responses
schema.sql: CREATE TABLE `survey_responses` (`id` char(36) not null, `survey_name` varchar(255) not null, `respondent_email` varchar(255) null, `satisfaction_rating` integer not null, `would_recommend` boolean null default '0', `feedback` text null, `improvement_suggestions` text null, `date_submitted` datetime null, primary key (`id`))
